de.systemagmbh.tools.io
Class CSysFileTool

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.io.CSysFileTool
public final class CSysFileTool
extends Object

The class CSysFileTool provides some useful methods for file handling.

Version:
$Revision: 1.6 $
Author:
Herbert Helmstreit, Christian Schwendner, Marco Panhans, Rüdiger Breit, Christian Wohanka

copyFileOverwrite

public static void copyFileOverwrite(String iFile,
                                     String oFile)
                              throws IOException
Deprecated. Use copyFileOverwrite(java.io.File, java.io.File) instead.

Copies a file, overwriting 'to' file if it already exists.

Parameters:
iFile - The input file that has to be copied.
oFile - The output file of the copy process.
Throws:
IOException - If copying fails at the system level.

createDir

public static CSysFile createDir(String pathname)
Create a directory on the file system. If the directory exists, this method returns the existing directory.

Parameters:
pathname - A pathname String denoting to a directory
Returns:
File Object representing the directory or null if the directory could not be created

createFile

public static CSysFile createFile(String pathname)
Create a file on the file system. If the file exitsts this method returns the existing file.

Parameters:
pathname - A pathname String denoting to a file
Returns:
File Object representing the file or null if the file could not be created.

deleteFile

public static void deleteFile(File file)
Delete the given file. The file can also be a directory. In this case it will recursively try to delete all elements in the directory.
There is no feedback if the delete was successful. The routine will not stop if one of the files can not be deleted for any reason.

Parameters:
file - The file that has to be deleted.
